intro: Acinodendron reticulatum, commonly known as the net-veined acacia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinctive net-like venation pattern. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a legume pod containing several seeds. It is often found in dry savannas and is adapted to arid conditions.
